prompt: What is the largest animal known to have ever existed?
pred: The largest animal known to have ever existed is the blue whale (Balaenoptera musculus). On average, an adult blue whale can grow up to 82 feet (25 meters) in length and weigh around 150-170 tons. However, the largest blue whale ever recorded was a female that measured around 108 feet (33 meters) in length and weighed approximately 210 tons. Blue whales are not only the largest animal currently alive, but they are also the largest animal that has ever existed, surpassing the size of other extinct giants like the Argentinosaurus, which is estimated to have been around 100-120 feet (30-37 meters) long and weighed around 80-100 tons.
